title: In situ PCR using leaf epidermal peels

protocol.title: In situ PCR using leaf epidermal peels
protocol.title_html: In situ PCR using leaf epidermal peels

source.description: The day before: prepare slides by placing frame seals on glass slide and apply pressure to borders to seal. These can be heated in thermal cycler at 90 °C for 10 minutes. Cut off excess seal to allow slide to sit appropriately in PCR machine.

Prepare fresh fixative and keep on ice:
    Prepare fresh and use within 3 hours.

Setup Turbo DNAse (Ambion) mastermix.
AB
1Component x1 rxn (μl)
2sterile milliQ H2087
310X Buffer 10
4DNase 3

AB
1Component x1 rxn (μl)
2sterile milliQ H2087
310X Buffer 10
4DNase 3

Setup RT mix (Thermoscript RT or Superscript III)
AB
1Componentx1 rxn (μl)
2Sterile milliQ H2061
35X Buffer20
410 mM dNTPs10
5Reverse primer (20 uM)2.5
6DTT 0.1 M5

AB
1Componentx1 rxn (μl)
2Sterile milliQ H2061
35X Buffer20
410 mM dNTPs10
5Reverse primer (20 uM)2.5
6DTT 0.1 M5
Bring plants to fume hood for epidermal peeling along with fixative, microscope slide and frame-seal. Keep all on ice for fixing and washing peels.
Add 100ul fixative onto all microscope slides.

Make epidermal peels (try to place 3-5 moderately sized peels per slide) and place directly into fixative on slide using a fine paint brush. Randomise which peels go to which slide (at this point, there should be no allocation of which slide will be used for which gene – can make this decision based on peel + slide quality).
Wear gloves, handle formaldehyde with care.
Incubate peels in fixative for 45 minutes, refreshing the fixative (with pipette) approximately every 15 minutes (apply evenly across peels on each slide).

From this point, the remainder of the protocol can be performed at lab bench. Wipe off any excess liquid to ensure no formaldehyde remains.
SAFE PAUSE POINT
Wash 3 x 5 min in 1x PBS (0.1 M Na2HPO4, 1.3 M NaCl, pH 7.5, stored at room temperature <1 year).
After last wash, remove as much wash buffer as possible.

Heat inactivate at 70 °C for 15 mins. Place on ice.
NOTE: Do not cool in thermal cycler as it can lead to cracking of glass slides.
Add 3 μl 0.5 M EDTA to give final concentration of 15 mM.
Remove PBS solution and add 100 μl of mastermix to each slide.
Incubate 37 °C for 45 mins.

At this point, it must be decided which genes are being studied on which slides. There must be two control slides: one positive housekeeper (e.g. 18S rRNA) control and one no RT housekeeper negative control.

Remove DNase mix and wash 2x with ice-cold sterilised water.
Do not remove final wash before RT reaction mix is ready!
Add 98.5 µl of mastermix to all slides
Incubate slides at 65 °C for 5 minutes, then place on ice for 1 min.
Add 1.5 µl of RT enzyme (Thermoscript or Superscript III) to all slides EXCEPT negative housekeeper control. Pipette up-and-down gently to mix around.

Run thermal cycle at 55 °C for 30 mins, 70 °C for 15 mins, then hold at 4°C (better to take out of machine and keep on ice).
This is a safe PAUSE POINT (keep slides covered in fridge).
Remove RT solution from slides (keep slides on ice).
Wash slides twice for 1 min with 100 µl ice-cold sterile water. When ready to proceed, remove as much water as possible (use a 10/20 µl pipette to get as much as possible).

Setup PCR mix (HiFi Phusion Taq)
AB
1Componentper slide (µl)
2Sterile milliQ H2074.6
35X Buffer20
410 mM dNTPs2
5polymerase0.5
6DIG-11-dUTP (1 mM)0.4
7Reverse primer (20 µM)1.25
8Forward primer (20 µM)1.25

AB
1Componentper slide (µl)
2Sterile milliQ H2074.6
35X Buffer20
410 mM dNTPs2
5polymerase0.5
6DIG-11-dUTP (1 mM)0.4
7Reverse primer (20 µM)1.25
8Forward primer (20 µM)1.25

Distribute PCR mix equally across the slide by pipetting and run PCR:
  1. 95 °C 30 min
  2. 95 °C 10 min
  3. 60 °C 25 min
  4. 72 °C 5 min
  5. Return to step 2 20–35x
  6. 72 °C 7 minutes
  7. 10 °C hold (better to take slide out).

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Remove frame-seal chamber completely and perform remainder directly on slide. During incubation, place slide in small plastic box to minimise evaporation.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Pipette off remaining PCR solution.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Wash twice for 5 min in 100 µl 1x PBS.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description:
Gently add 100 µl of 1x Block solution and incubate 30 min on ice.
10X Block solution: 10 mg BSA in 1 mL 10x PBS

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Dilute anti-DIG-AP antibody 1:500 in 1x Block solution, keep on ice.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Pipette off as much 1X block solution as possible.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Add 50 µl of diluted anti-DIG-AP antibody and incubate at room temperature for 1 hour.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description:
Remove antibody solution and wash twice for 15 min at room temperature in Wash Buffer 2 (can transfer peels to another microscope slide if desired; keep in wash buffer 2).
Wash Buffer 2: 0.1 M TRIS-HCl, 0.15 M NaCl, pH 9.5

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Remove wash buffer 2.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Add 50 µl BM purple (AP substrate). This is light sensitive, incubate in dark (e.g. drawer, or cover) and keep on ice.

source.title: Colorimetric detection of DIG labelled products

source.description: Staining can occur anywhere between 10 min – 2 hours. Optimize as appropriate. If no signal is detected after 1 hour, refresh BM purple (take off and add another 50 µl).
Once stain has developed, pipette off BM purple.
Add 100 µl Wash Buffer 2 and wash 3x 5 min to remove residual stain and debris.
Wash once with sterile water, then remove all water.
Mount section in 40 µl 40% glycerol (40–150 µl depending on number of peels on slide). Do not use excessive amounts of glycerol.
Place coverslip on top and seal corners with nail varnish. Coverslip should not float (remove some glycerol if needed). NB do not slide coverslip, instead just drop directly onto peels/glycerol.
Visualise under bright field microscope. Slides can be stored at room temp and is good ~3 weeks. Ensure all peels are imaged using the same settings.

description:
Method for visualizing cell-localized gene expression patterns.
Adapted from: 
Athman, A., Tanz, S.K., Conn, V.M., Jordans, C., Mayo, G.M., Ng, W.W., Burton, R.A., Conn, S.J., and Gilliham, M. (2014). Protocol: a fast and simple in situ PCR method for localising gene expression in plant tissue. Plant Methods 10: 29.
Also, for more information on epidermal peels: 
Chen, Z.-H., Eisenach, C., Xu, X.-Q., Hills, A., and Blatt, M.R. (2012). Protocol: optimised electrophyiological analysis of intact guard cells from Arabidopsis. Plant Methods 8: 15.
